alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:53AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurel, northeastern Pulaski, southwestern Jackson and Rockcastle Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 452 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Boone to 7 miles south of Stanford. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boone, Snider and Conway around 500 AM EDT. Disputanta, Roundstone and Wildie around 505 AM EDT. Threelinks, Climax, Bee Lick, Bummer, Ottowa and Hummel around 510 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bandy, Woodstock, Goochland, Willailla, Johnetta, Quail, Cooksburg, Bromo, Spiro, Dudley Station, Loam, Level Green, Robinet, Jep Hill, Wabp, Sand Springs, Donaro, Withers, Middlefork, Dango, Ardery, Carico, Valley Oak, Hansford, Cruise, Horse Lick, Templer, Lamero, Deese, Dabolt, Bloss, Parrot, Pongo, Eberle, Luner and Mershons. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 49 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 31 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
